readme_content:
ðŸŒˆ MacOS Colorpicker App Shortcut

A little applescript app to directly access the official Apple colorpicker tool.

## 1. Table of Contents * 1. [Table of Contents](#TableofContents) * 2. [About The Project](#AboutTheProject) * 2.1. [Built With](#BuiltWith) * 2.2. [Installation](#Installation) * 3. [Usage](#Usage) * 4. [ Customising](#Customising) * 5. [Troubleshooting](#Troubleshooting) * 6. [Contributing](#Contributing) * 7. [License](#License) * 8. [Contact](#Contact) * 8.1. [Credit](#Credit) * 9. [Changelog](#Changelog) ## 2. About The Project ![colorpicker](https://github.com/IORoot/macos__colorpicker--app/blob/79a9a5cfedcdf508e24ee0e9117b3811b1758164/docs/colorpicker.png?raw=true)

(back to top)

### 2.1. Built With This project was built with the following frameworks, technologies and software. - [Apple Script Editor](https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/script-editor/welcome/mac)

(back to top)

### 2.2. Installation Open terminal and run: ``` cd $HOME/Downloads && git clone https://github.com/IORoot/macos__colorpicker--app.git ``` This will download this repo into your home /Downloads folder. (optional) Drag the Apps into your Application folder. Or just run from wherever you like.

(back to top)

## 3. Usage There is no current way to open the built-in Apple macos colorpicker without using another program to access it. This little helper app allows you to open the color-picker without needing to do that. You can drag this into your Applications folder or dock and run whenever you like. ## 4. Customising None ## 5. Troubleshooting None

(back to top)
